Could this method be static? Maybe also secureKeyPrefix
Any explicit visibility to add?
But maybe these additions complicate the testing verifying number of invocations

Yes, i didnt want to change static/instance, as i dont know if it has consequences, but i'll do it.
And for the access level, i put package to be accesible from Tests, as you said... and it could be protected to be accessed also by subclass.

Done. Not static, since is more complicated to test, and its out of scope.
And if we wanted to extend the behaviour of this class, wouldnt it be better if its an instance method? @ajlopez

Could we add an additional test using MANY keys?
I guess the code could be rewritten to have only a variable with the last key processed, and this test would pass
Could we add a second for, testing again each address? I guess this code could still be satisfied having only one internal variable derived from the last address processed.
Now i think it goes, didnt get it in the first comment
I would add a comment explaining that this cache is safe because we a RskAddress is immutable and it's a purely functional mapping
